Package de.yamass.redg.runtime

Class AbstractRedG

java.lang.Object
de.yamass.redg.runtime.AbstractRedG
public abstract class AbstractRedG extends Object
The abstract super class for all RedG main classes.

  • Method Details

    • addEntity

      public void addEntity(RedGEntity entity)

    • getDefaultValueStrategy

      public DefaultValueStrategy getDefaultValueStrategy()
      Returns the default value strategy used to fill not provided values for the entities
      Returns:
      The current default value strategy

    • setDefaultValueStrategy

      public void setDefaultValueStrategy(DefaultValueStrategy defaultValueStrategy)
      Sets the default value strategy. May only be called before entities are created, otherwise an IllegalStateException gets thrown. Passing null resets the strategy to a DefaultDefaultValueStrategy.
      Parameters:
      defaultValueStrategy - The new default value strategy to use from now on

    • getSqlValuesFormatter

      public SQLValuesFormatter getSqlValuesFormatter()
      Returns the formatter used to format the values for the sql insert string.
      Returns:
      The current value formatter

    • setSqlValuesFormatter

      public void setSqlValuesFormatter(SQLValuesFormatter sqlValuesFormatter)
      Sets the insert value formatter. Passing null resets it to a DefaultSQLValuesFormatter. Must not be called after entities are created or an IllegalStateException gets thrown.
      Parameters:
      sqlValuesFormatter - The new insert value formatter

    • getPreparedStatementParameterSetter

      public PreparedStatementParameterSetter getPreparedStatementParameterSetter()
      Returns the transformer that is used to set parameter values on PreparedStatements.
      Returns:
      The PreparedStatementParameterSetter

    • setPreparedStatementParameterSetter

      public void setPreparedStatementParameterSetter(PreparedStatementParameterSetter preparedStatementParameterSetter)
      Sets the PreparedStatementParameterSetter that will be used to set parameter values on PreparedStatements. Must not be called after entities are created or an IllegalStateException gets thrown.
      Parameters:
      preparedStatementParameterSetter - new The PreparedStatementParameterSetter.

    • getDummyFactory

      public DummyFactory getDummyFactory()
      Returns the current DummyFactory that will be used to create dummy entities.
      Returns:
      The current dummy factory

    • setDummyFactory

      public void setDummyFactory(DummyFactory dummyFactory)
      Sets the new dummy factory, that will be used to generate dummy entities from now on. Changing this does not affect old dummy entities. Must not be called after entities are created or an IllegalStateException gets thrown.
      Parameters:
      dummyFactory - The new dummy factory. If null, a DefaultDummyFactory gets used.

    • generateSQLStatements

      public List<String> generateSQLStatements()
      Returns a list of insert statements, one for each added entity in the respective order they were added.
      Returns:
      The SQL Insert strings

    • insertDataIntoDatabase

      public void insertDataIntoDatabase(Connection connection)
      Inserts all data previously prepared by RedG into the database the Connection connects to. Entities are going to be inserted in the order they were added.
      This method uses prepared statements to efficiently insert even great amount of data.
      If a Insertion/Update updates more than 1 entry, a warning will be logged to the console. If a entity that is marked as "existing" (via redG.existingX()) is not found, an error will be logged and an ExistingEntryMissingException will be thrown.
      Parameters:
      connection - The database connection
      Throws:
      ExistingEntryMissingException - When an entry defined as "existing" (via redG.existingX()) cannot be found in the database
      InsertionFailedException - When problems with the prepared statement occur. This is often the result of a faulty data type mapping or PreparedStatementParameterSetter

    • findSingleEntity

      public <T extends RedGEntity> T findSingleEntity(Class<T> type, Predicate<T> filter)
      Finds a single entity in the list of entities to insert into the database. If multiple entities match the Predicate, the entity that was added first will be returned.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The entity type
      Parameters:
      type - The class of the entity
      filter - A predicate that gets called for every entity that has the requested type. Should return true only for the entity that should be found
      Returns:
      The found entity. If no entity is found an IllegalArgumentException gets thrown.

    • findEntities

      public <T extends RedGEntity> List<T> findEntities(Class<T> type, Predicate<T> filter)
      Searches through the list of entities to insert into the database and returns all of the specified type that match the passed Predicate.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The entity type
      Parameters:
      type - The class of the entities that should be searched for
      filter - A predicate that gets called for every entity that has the requested type. An entity gets added to the entities returned by this method if the predicate returns true
      Returns:
      A list of all entities of the requested type that match the predicate

    • getEntities

      public List<RedGEntity> getEntities()

    • getEntitiesSortedForInsert

      public List<RedGEntity> getEntitiesSortedForInsert()

    • getVisualizationJson

      public abstract String getVisualizationJson()
